title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.3 ADOLESCENT DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: Output 2.3. By 2025, adolescents' girls and boys are empowered with skills for personal empowerment, active citizenship and/or employability, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2. By 2025, girls and boys aged 3-19 progressively achieve age-appropriate learning outcomes

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.3. By 2025, adolescents? girls and boys are empowered with skills for personal empowerment, active citizenship and/oremployability

description.narrative: Towards empowering;adolescent girls and boys and improving their resilience, UNICEF expanded the skilling programme reaching 121,954 vulnerable adolescents, and school capacity strengthening with a functional VAC/GBV prevention and response mechanism. An approach for multiple pathways to skilling was operationalized by piloting the Teaching at the Right Level (TaRL) methodology in schools in refugee-hosting districts, as well as the rollout of the Life Skills Toolkit with MoES in 13 districts and introduction of the social innovation programme (UPSHIFT) for out-of-school adolescents. Moreover, school re-entry guidelines for adolescent mothers provided second chance education for the most vulnerable group of girls. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:08/01/2022
